message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY

This paper presents a tool for text analysis that uses deep learning and neural embeddings to generate and validate new lexical categories. The paper focuses on the broad range of topics that human language can cover, which suggests that it could fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. However, the use of deep learning and neural embeddings for text analysis suggests that cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper's focus on data-driven, human validated categories suggests that it could also fit into cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper's emphasis on analyzing text across multiple categories suggests that it could also fit into cs.CY (Computers and Society).
